title: Basic Sheet Pan Chicken Sausage and Roasted Cabbage Recipe
description: This baked chicken sausage recipe is so easy to make and perfect for fall! Chicken sausages, apple, onion, and cabbage make this family-friendly, one-pan dinner perfect for an easy, quick, low-carb meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Baked and Roasted Basic Sheet Pan Chicken Sausage and Roasted Cabbage 4.7 (10) 9 Reviews 9 Photos This baked chicken sausage recipe is so easy to make and perfect for fall! Chicken sausages, apple, onion, and cabbage make this family-friendly, one-pan dinner totally irresistible. Submitted by Fioa Updated on January 24, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 9 9 9 9 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings cooking spray 8 cups shredded cabbage 1 apple, sliced 1 white onion, sliced 2 tablespoons olive oil 1 ½ tablespoons white vinegar 1 teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon ground black pepper 8 links chicken sausage Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray. Combine cabbage, apple, onion, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a large bowl; toss until well coated. Place in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until slightly tender, about 20 minutes. Toss cabbage mixture and place sausages on top. Bake until sausages are crispy and cabbage has caramelized, about 10 minutes more. I Made It Print 21 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 419 Calories 22g Fat 27g Carbs 27g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 419 % Daily Value * Total Fat 22g 29% Saturated Fat 6g 28% Cholesterol 106mg 35% Sodium 2134mg 93% Total Carbohydrate 27g 10% Dietary Fiber 6g 23% Total Sugars 15g Protein 27g 55% Vitamin C 71mg 79% Calcium 88mg 7% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 426mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Basic Sheet Pan Chicken Sausage and Roasted Cabbage 01 of 09 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 09 Photo by  Linda T 12/31/2021 Easy and delicious. I made it even easier by buying a bag of shredded cabbage. I also used a red onion and a spicy chicken sausage Next time I will add the sausage at the same time as everything else.. that didn't really get browned. 03 of 09 Photo by  Theresa Livingston 01/08/2020 I did make a few alterations. I use a Honey Crisp apple (b/c it wasn't stated which kind to use) I also used Onion Soup mix & Adobe seasoning. I just mixed everything on the baking sheet covered it with foil and put it in the oven for 20 minutes then cooked it for an extra 10 minutes uncovered just to make sure the sausages were cooked. Even my picky eater gave it a thumbs up. 04 of 09 Photo by  Theresa Livingston 01/08/2020 I did make a few alterations. I use a Honey Crisp apple (b/c it wasn't stated which kind to use) I also used Onion Soup mix & Adobe seasoning. I just mixed everything on the baking sheet covered it with foil and put it in the oven for 20 minutes then cooked it for an extra 10 minutes uncovered just to make sure the sausages were cooked. Even my picky eater gave it a thumbs up. 05 of 09 Photo by  Nick H 01/09/2018 I’d been looking at this recipe, and my son happened to say he wanted cabbage for dinner... ( like that happens...ever!) I chucked a cabbage and some other bits I could remember from the recipe into the cart, and legged it to the cashier, before he could change his mind. I used a desert apple, red onion, lemon juice instead of vinegar, I had to use a smoked sausage from the deli as I couldn't find chicken sausages, this recipe was simple, quick to put together and I loved the uncomplicated flavour of it... my son decided he doesn't like black pepper so he pushed it around his plate but ate the sausages... you win some, you lose some. 06 of 09 Photo by  Nick H 01/09/2018 I’d been looking at this recipe, and my son happened to say he wanted cabbage for dinner... ( like that happens...ever!) I chucked a cabbage and some other bits I could remember from the recipe into the cart, and legged it to the cashier, before he could change his mind. I used a desert apple, red onion, lemon juice instead of vinegar, I had to use a smoked sausage from the deli as I couldn't find chicken sausages, this recipe was simple, quick to put together and I loved the uncomplicated flavour of it... my son decided he doesn't like black pepper so he pushed it around his plate but ate the sausages... you win some, you lose some. 07 of 09 Photo by  Fioa 11/27/2017 08 of 09 Photo by  Fioa 11/27/2017 1 You’ll Also Love Sheet Pan Sausage and Seasonal Vegetables 4 Ratings Keto Smoky Chicken and Vegetable Sheet Pan Dinner 26 Ratings Sausage Egg Roll in Bowl 54 Ratings Chicken Soup with Cabbage 25 Ratings Garlic Pulled Pork Bavarian Kohlrabi Soup 9 Ratings Egg Roll in a Bowl 40 Ratings Sesame Chicken Salad 1 Rating Dak Galbi (Korean Spicy Chicken Stir-Fry) Sheet Pan Passover Dinner 1 Rating Spicy Chicken Noodles 55 Ratings Ground Turkey Burritos That Will Fool Your Kids 5 Ratings Veggie Nacho Salad Chicken, Apple, and Brussels Sprout Sheet Pan Dinner 31 Ratings Hungarian Potato and Sausage Soup 90 Ratings Deconstructed Egg Rolls Muffin Tin Style 3 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Fioa
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray.;Combine cabbage, apple, onion, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a large bowl; toss until well coated. Place in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.;Bake in the preheated oven until slightly tender, about 20 minutes. Toss cabbage mixture and place sausages on top. Bake until sausages are crispy and cabbage has caramelized, about 10 minutes more.
